title: Have you ever felt the urge to jump into a stranger’s conversation? - Quora

response.answer_text: Have you ever felt the urge to jump into a stranger’s conversation? Occasionally. Especially if someone is on the receiving end of what sounds like a scam/pyramid scheme.

I do have to curb my desire to jump in conversations where I know I can try to help the parties problem solve. Just recently it was two people discussing how to get roommates to move out the the apartment. I was trained as an art director and my job was to problem solve for my clients in a graphic nature. I have since started my information research company and I certainly could help others especially if it may be information they may find handy. I have learned to curb this desire to jump in since I became a mediator. In mediation you learn how to listen and let the parties solve their dispute. The parties have to solve their problem. I have done eviction mediation and could certainly could butt in and offer my assistance. I did not. Why? Because I sensed more of what was going on with their dialogue. Lots of drama and emotions that came close to the surface. I know that if I interrupted, one of the parties would have turned on me. I chose wisely. Rox of Spazhouse Intuitive Research

It depends on the location and the conversation. I’m an extreme nosey nelly and lookie-Lou kind of person by nature. I can’t help it, it just happens. If I’m in a public space and I overhear someone very confused or having leisurely conversation, like a grocery store, train station or airport. I will jump in to pass time or whatever. If it’s something really important and/or burn-bookesque I will just listen, and tell everyone about it later.

All the time. Actually i just don’t feel the urge too but i have a bad habit of jumping into it. Most of the time its not bad , i end up making new friends or learning something new. However i do have bad experience too since not everyone is open to people being nosy .
